trans-unit.source: The author(s) who published the full name
Author name and year, used in mineralogy or bacterology
The first person(s) who validly published a species
Author team of the basionym of a combination
The original author when a species was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication
The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination and the year of its publication
Genus or higher taxon name, used in each domain
Flag indicating that this is a hybrid ("x") or a chimaera ("+")
Valid name
Used for cultivated plant name elements
Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies
Species name, used in zoology or bacteriology
Subgenus name, used in zoology or bacteriology
Used to indicate the author and year
Subspecies name, used in zoology or bacteriology
A formal category for cultivars , individual plants or assemblages of plants on the basis of defined similarity
a cultivar name, which is a Latin botanical name followed by an epithet, mostly in a vernacular language
species epithet or the epithet of the subdivision of a genus
The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank
Trade name used for a specific cultivar
Name of the breed of an animal
The accepted acronym for the Virus, e.g. PCV for Peanut Clump Virus
The formal name of a viral species. Example: Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A
